Definition: A tool that enables you to view and debug the accessibility properties of user interfaces.
A macOS developer tool that lets you examine the accessibility properties of UI elements in apps and webpages.
A tool from Microsoft that helps developers find and fix accessibility issues in Windows applications by inspecting UI elements and running tests.

A structured, hierarchical representation of a user interface  that is exposed to assistive technologies. It is built from the underlying UI elements and reflects only the parts of the interface that are relevant for accessibility.

Assistive technology for anyone with limited mobility. It enables you to interact with a device by activating a switch, such as pressing an external adaptive button, performing a head movement, or making a voiced or voiceless sound.
